description: A user's desktop computer will not power on or is entirely unresponsive.
Device fails to boot, frequently crashes, or exhibits hardware issues like overheating or battery swelling.
Printer or scanner has hardware/software errors like jams or connectivity issues.
Accessories like a keyboard, webcam, or docking station are unresponsive, broken, or not detected.
Mobile device is unresponsive, crashes, or won't enroll in mobile management.
User-level UPS is beeping, in bypass, or nearing battery end-of-life.
Windows or macOS is crashing, in a boot loop, or impacted by driver or update issues.
A business-critical app (e.g., EMR, POS) is inaccessible or malfunctioning.
A convenience or utility app (e.g., Slack, Notepad++) is misbehaving but non-urgent.
Ethernet jack or VLAN issue causing no connection at the user's desk.
Slow network performance, packet loss, or high jitter affecting cloud apps or VoIP.
Networking gear like a switch or firewall has failed hardware or is offline.
Wi-Fi issues such as dropped connections, roaming failures, or poor signal.
Internet connection is down, unstable, or performing below contractual speeds.
On-prem or cloud server is slow, crashing, or failing due to CPU, RAM, or disk I/O issues.
Cloud platforms like Azure or VMware are degraded due to resource constraints.
Physical host has hardware faults like RAID failure, PSU errors, or thermal issues.
Rack-mounted UPS for critical systems is failing, alarming, or has expired batteries.
Core systems like DNS, DHCP, or NTP are unavailable, leading to widespread issues.
Endpoint protection tools (e.g., SentinelOne, Bitdefender) are disabled or blocking legitimate processes.
Post-vulnerability scan task requiring patching or config changes to reduce risk.
Physical security devices like cameras, door locks, or DVRs are down or unreachable.
Full onboarding of an employee — account creation, access provisioning, and device prep.
Secure offboarding — disable access, recover equipment, and archive data.
Setup or deployment of physical hardware like laptops, monitors, or docking stations.
Login issues/Reset a password or unlock an account while preserving group memberships.
Add or remove access to systems, folders, groups, or applications.
Install a specific app outside the standard software catalog.
Set up or adjust VPN, RDP, or remote-help permissions for a user.
Scheduled onsite visit for proactive equipment maintenance.
Apply vendor updates or patches to LOB or productivity software.
Renew or install an SSL certificate on public-facing systems.
Update firmware on servers, switches, or other infrastructure components.
Persistent failures in cloud platforms, often with timing or regional patterns.
Business application crashes or errors recur, indicating deeper problems.
Physical server instability over time (e.g., memory errors, disk failures).
Ongoing slowness or connection drops tied to backups or peak usage.
Recurring reboots or failures in network equipment, likely firmware related.
Repeat endpoint issues such as slow performance after resume from sleep.
Documented analysis of the issue, including logs, impact, timeline, and a corrective action plan.
Perform internal or client-facing audits to assess compliance or service quality.
Strategic or routine business check-in meetings such as QBRs.
Clean up SOPs, KBs, architecture diagrams, or client documentation.
Pre-closeout checklist and validation for project deliverables.
